# Token Audit

> Token Audit is a Python CLI tool for analyzing MCP (Model Context Protocol) efficiency and token usage across AI coding sessions. It supports Claude Code, Codex CLI, and Gemini CLI platforms.

## Installation

```bash
pip install token-audit
```

## Key Features

- Multi-platform session analysis (Claude Code, Codex CLI, Gemini CLI)
- Token usage tracking and cost estimation
- MCP server efficiency metrics
- Interactive TUI dashboard with Rich
- Smell detection for suboptimal patterns
- Export to CSV, JSON, and AI-friendly markdown

## Docs

- [README](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/littlebearapps/token-audit/main/README.md): Complete installation, usage guide, and feature overview
- [Architecture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/littlebearapps/token-audit/main/docs/architecture.md): System design and component relationships
- [Data Contract](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/littlebearapps/token-audit/main/docs/data-contract.md): Data format guarantees and schema documentation
- [TUI Guide](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/littlebearapps/token-audit/main/docs/tui-guide.md): Interactive dashboard navigation and features
- [Features](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/littlebearapps/token-audit/main/docs/features.md): Detailed feature documentation

## CLI Commands

- `token-audit collect` - Collect session data from AI coding tools
- `token-audit report` - Generate usage reports with cost analysis
- `token-audit ui` - Launch interactive TUI dashboard
- `token-audit export` - Export data to CSV, JSON, or AI markdown
- `token-audit init` - Initialize configuration
